Topics include problem solving and logic, sets, voting systems, graphs, number systems, geometry, mathematics of finance, combinatorics, and probability and statistics. Culture & Media, Comm and Culture Studies, Theatre & Electr. Media Perf., English, Theatre & Entertain Tech (BS), Theatre & Entertain Tech (BA), Liberal Arts, Psychology, Sports and Fitness Management, History, Social Sciences, Liberal Arts with History Opt, Sustainability Sci and Society, Scientific & Tech Comm (BA), Scientific & Tech Comm (BS), Humanities Pre-Requisite(s): ALEKS Math Placement >= 00 or ACT Mathematics >= 10 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 260

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Anthropology, Communication,

Mathematical Sciences.title: College Algebra I
Mathematical Sciences.description: This course is the first of a two semester sequence. It examines the behavior of linear, polynomial, and rational functions. In addition, algebraic methods commonly needed in calculus are reviewed. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 199 Pre-Requisite(s): ALEKS Math Placement >= 46 or ACT Mathematics >= 18 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 500

Mathematical Sciences.title: College Algebra II with Trigonometry
Mathematical Sciences.description: This course is the second of a two semester sequence. It examines the behavior of exponential, logarithmic, and trigonometric functions. Also, algebraic and trigonometric methods commonly needed in calculus are reviewed. MA1030 and MA1031 together are equivalent to MA1032. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1030

Mathematical Sciences.title: Precalculus
Mathematical Sciences.description: This course examines the behavior of linear, polynomial, rational, exponential, logarithmic and trigonometric functions. Pre-Requisite(s): ALEKS Math Placement >= 61 or ACT Mathematics >= 22 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 540

Mathematical Sciences.title: Single-Variable Calculus with Integrated Precalculus I
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to single-variable calculus with precalculus review. Topics include behavior of elementary functions, limits, continuity, differentiation, and applications. Integrates symbolic tools, graphical concepts, data, and numerical calculations. Pre-Requisite(s): ACT Mathematics >= 22 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 540 or ALEKS Math Placement >= 61

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering

Mathematical Sciences.title: Single-Variable Calculus with Integrated Precalculus II
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to single-variable calculus with precalculus review. Topics include further applications of derivatives, definite and indefinite integrals, the fundamental theorem of calculus, basic integration techniques, and applications. Integrates symbolic tools, graphical concepts, data and numerical calculations. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1120

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering

Mathematical Sciences.title: Calculus for Life Sciences
Mathematical Sciences.description: Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 200 Topics include limits, continuity of functions, transcendental functions, derivatives, integrals, and applications of the derivative in the fields of economics, biological sciences, and social sciences. Credit applicable only to those curricula specifying this course. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1032 or MA 1031 or MA 1120 or ALEKS Math Placement >= 76 or CEEB Calculus AB >= 2 or CEEB Calculus BC >= 2 or CEEB Calculus AB Subscore >= 2 or ACT Mathematics >= 26 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 610

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering

Mathematical Sciences.title: Calculus with Technology I
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introduction to single-variable calculus, which includes a computer laboratory. Topics include trigonometric, exponential, and logarithmic functions, differentiation and its uses, and basic integration. Integrates symbolic tools, graphical concepts, data and numerical calculations. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1120 or ALEKS Math Placement >= 86 or CEEB Calculus AB >= 3 or CEEB Calculus BC >= 3 or CEEB Calculus AB Subscore >= 3 or ACT Mathematics >= 29 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 680

Mathematical Sciences.title: Calculus Plus w/ Technology I
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introduction to single-variable calculus, which includes a computer laboratory. Topics include trigonometric, exponential, logarithmic functions, differentiation and its uses, and basic integration. Integrates symbolic tools, data and numerics, and graphical concepts and is similar to MA1160, going at a different pace. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1032 or MA 1031 or MA 1120 or ALEKS Math Placement >= 76 or CEEB Calculus AB >= 2 or CEEB Calculus BC >= 2 or CEEB Calculus AB Subscore >= 2 or ACT Mathematics >= 26 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 610

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Scientific Simulation
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to simulation, a powerful computational tool for many scientific problems. Case studies and projects will be drawn from various fields. Prior programming experience is not required; all necessary computational skills will be developed in the course. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1121

Mathematical Sciences.title: Exploring Symmetry Groups
Mathematical Sciences.description: Mathematical discovery and invention in group theory: transformations, finite figures, strip patterns, wall patterns, finite groups, and Cayley diagrams. Develops the ability to find and describe patterns, to generalize from observations, to formulate conjectures, and to support conjectures with analysis and, Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 201 when possible, formal proof.

Mathematical Sciences.title: Exploring Knots and Surfaces
Mathematical Sciences.description: Mathematical discovery and invention in topological graph theory: networks, graphs, graph coloring, surfaces and graphs, and knots. Develops the ability to find and describe patterns, to generalize from observations, to formulate conjectures, and to support conjectures with analysis and, when possible, formal proof.

Mathematical Sciences.title: Exploring Number Theory
Mathematical Sciences.description: Mathematical discovery and invention in number theory: number puzzles, Chinese Remainder Theorem, codes, primitive roots, and quadratic reciprocity. Develops the ability to find and describe patterns, to generalize from observations, to formulate conjectures, and to support conjectures with analysis and, when possible, formal proof.

Mathematical Sciences.title: Exploring Non-Euclidean Geometry
Mathematical Sciences.description: Mathematical discovery and invention in Non-Euclidean geometry: definitions of straight and angle, transformations, congruence, parallel transport, projections, and finite geometries. Develops the ability to find and describe patterns, to generalize from observations, to formulate conjectures, and to support conjectures with analysis and, when possible, formal proof.

Mathematical Sciences.title: Elementary Mathematics Topics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Students study a particular area in mathematics, ordinarily not covered in existing courses. Intended for first- year students.

tags.Credits: variable to 6.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6
tags.Restrictions: Permission of instructor required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Calculus with Technology II
Mathematical Sciences.description: Continued study of calculus, which includes a computer laboratory. Topics include integration and its uses, function approximation, vectors, and elementary modeling with differential equations. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1135 or MA 1121 or CEEB Calculus AB >= 3 or CEEB Calculus BC >= 3 or CEEB Calculus AB Subscore >= 3 Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 202

Mathematical Sciences.title: Elementary Linear Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introduction to linear algebra and how it can be used. Topics include systems of equations, vectors, matrices, orthogonality, subspaces, and the eigenvalue problem. Engineering, Computer Science Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1135 or MA 1121

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mathematics, Software

Mathematical Sciences.title: Elementary Linear Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: Offered first half of semester, to be taken concurrently with MA3521. The course is an introduction to linear algebra and how it can be used. Topics include systems of equations, vectors, matrices, orthogonality, subspaces and the eigenvalue problem. Engineering, Computer Science Co-Requisite(s): MA 3521 Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mathematics, Software

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Linear Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introduction to linear algebra and how it can be used, including basic mathematical proofs. Topics include systems of equations, vectors, matrices, orthogonality, subspaces, and the eigenvalue problem. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1135 or MA 1121

Mathematical Sciences.title: Scientific Computing
Mathematical Sciences.description: Use of mathematical modeling and computer simulation to solve scientific problems. Includes introduction to elementary numerical methods (numerical integration, solution of linear systems, solution of nonlinear equations, optimization) and to computer programming. Requires programming project(s). Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 and (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Statistical Analysis
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to statistical reasoning and methods. Topics include uses and abuses of statistics, graphical and descriptive methods, correlation and regression, probability and statistical inference. The course will include a written project and an introduction to statistical software. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 203 Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1135 or MA 1121

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Statistics, Mathematics & Computer

Mathematical Sciences.title: Statistical Methods
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to the design and analysis of statistical studies. Topics include methods of data collection, descriptive and graphical methods, probability, statistical inference on means, regression and correlation, and ANOVA. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1020 or MA 1030 or MA 1120 or MA 1032 or MA 1031 or ALEKS Math Placement >= 61 or CEEB Calculus BC >= 2 or CEEB Calculus AB Subscore >= 2 or ACT Mathematics >= 22 or SAT MATH SECTION SCORE-M16 >= 540

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mathematics

Mathematical Sciences.title: Elementary Topics in Mathematics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Students study a particular area in mathematics ordinarily not covered in existing courses. Intended for first- or second-year students.

tags.Credits: variable to 4.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6
tags.Restrictions: Permission of instructor required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Multivariable Calculus with Technology
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to calculus in two and three dimensions, which includes a computer laboratory. Topics include functions of several variables, partial derivatives, the gradient, multiple integrals; introduction to vector-valued functions and vector calculus, divergence, curl, and the integration theorems of Green, Stokes, and Gauss. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 or CEEB Calculus BC >= 3

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Coding Theory
Mathematical Sciences.description: Transmission via noisy channels, hamming distance, linear codes, the ISBN-code, encoding and decoding, finite fields, Reed-Solomon codes, deep space communication, the compact disk code, sphere packing bound, hamming codes, hamming decoding. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Cryptography
Mathematical Sciences.description: Topics include private-key cryptography, shift substitution, permutation and stream ciphers, cryptanalysis, perfect secrecy, public-key cryptography, and the RSA cryptosystem. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 204 Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Combinatorics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Topics include set theory, mathematical induction, integers, functions and relations, counting methods, recurrence relations, generating functions, permutations, combinations, principle of inclusion and exclusion, graphs (including planar graphs). Further possible topics are graph coloring, trees and cut-sets, combinatorial designs, Boolean algebra. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Abstract Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to proofs in algebra. Topics include elementary number theory (induction, binomial theorem, fundamental theorem of arithmetic, Euclidean algorithm, congruences, Fermat's theorem), group theory (subgroups, cyclic groups, generators, Lagrange's theorem, normal groups, homomorphisms, quotients), ring theory (domains, fields, polynomials, homomorphisms). Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Real Analysis
Mathematical Sciences.description: Why calculus works: a careful study of the logical basis of calculus, with an emphasis on how to read and write proofs. Topics include set theory, real numbers, infinite sequences, continuity, derivatives and integrals for functions of one variable, sequences of functions, infinite series. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160

Mathematical Sciences.title: Elementary Differential Equations
Mathematical Sciences.description: First order equations, linear equations, and systems of equations. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 and (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330)

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mathematics, Computer Science

Mathematical Sciences.title: Elementary Differential Equations
Mathematical Sciences.description: Offered second half of semester, to be taken concurrently with MA2321. Topics include first order equations, linear equations and systems of equations. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 205 Co-Requisite(s): MA 2321 Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mathematics, Computer Science

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Differential Equations
Mathematical Sciences.description: First order equations, linear equations, systems of equations, and Laplace transforms. May include elementary separation of variables for partial differential equations. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 and (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Mathematical Modeling with Differential Equations
Mathematical Sciences.description: Creating differential equation models for physical problems such as population dynamics, kinetics, mass- spring systems. Topics include nondimensionalization, numerical methods, phase-plane analysis, first-order systems, linearization, and stability. Includes modeling case studies, using a computer algebra system, and a modeling project. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 and (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Engineering Statistics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to the design, conduct, and analysis of statistical studies aimed at solving engineering problems. Topics include methods of data collection, descriptive and graphical methods, probability and probability models, statistical inference, control charts, linear regression, design of experiments. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 or MA 3160(C)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Biostatistics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to the design and analysis of statistical studies in the health and life sciences. Topics include study design, descriptive and graphical methods, probability, inference on means, categorical data analysis, and linear regression. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1135 or MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1121 or MA 2160(C) or MA 3160(C)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Probability
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to probabilistic methods. Topics include probability laws, counting rules, discrete and continuous random variables, expectation, joint distributions, and limit theorems. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 206 Pre-Requisite(s): MA 1160 or MA 1161 or MA 1121 or MA 1135

Mathematical Sciences.title: Statistical Programming and Analysis
Mathematical Sciences.description: Project-based course enabling students to identify statistical methods and analysis using R and SAS. Topics include exploratory data analysis, classical statistical tests, sample size and power considerations, correlation, regression,and design experiments using advanced programming techniques. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to SAS Programming
Mathematical Sciences.description: This course is a workshop focused on solving problems for SAS certified base/certified programmers for SAS credentials. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715

tags.Credits: 1.0; Graded Pass/Fail Only

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Actuarial Mathematics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Nominal and effective rates of interest, present value, discount, annuities certain, sinking funds, bonds, yield rates, and amortization schedules. Financial calculator skills for professional exams. Immunization, swaps, interest rate policy. May include other topics on the FM exam. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3160(C)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Actuarial Exam Workshop
Mathematical Sciences.description: Topics from the Society of Actuaries professional examinations, primarily financial mathematics and probability. Review, preparation, and practice using SOA exams and other materials. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3160

tags.Credits: 1.0; Repeatable to a Max of 4; Graded Pass/Fail Only

Mathematical Sciences.title: College Geometry with Technology
Mathematical Sciences.description: Review of Euclidean geometry. Introduction to geometric constructions, conjecturing of theorems, methods of proof, 3-D geometry, finite geometries, and non-Euclidean geometries. Integrates computer software (e.g. Geometer's Sketchpad) throughout the course. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 207 Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 or MA 2330

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore

Mathematical Sciences.title: Math Sciences Teach Experience
Mathematical Sciences.description: Development of teaching skills through assisting in the instruction of a section of an entry-level undergraduate mathematics course. Students gain experience in leadership, group work, organization skills, cooperative exercise preparation, and class instruction.

tags.Credits: variable to 4.0; Repeatable to a Max of 4; Graded Pass/Fail Only
tags.Restrictions: Permission of instructor required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Intermediate Topics in Mathematics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Students study a particular area in mathematics, not ordinarily covered in existing courses. Intended for third- year students.

tags.Credits: variable to 4.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6
tags.Restrictions: Permission of instructor required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Optimization and Graph Algorithms
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introduction to linear and integer programming and related graph problems. Topics include simplex algorithm, duality, branch-and-bound and branch-and-cut, shortest paths, spanning trees, matchings, network flow, graph coloring, and perfect graphs. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3210

Mathematical Sciences.title: Combinatorics and Graph Theory
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introductory course in combinatorics and graph theory. Topics include designs, enumeration, extremal set theory, finite geometry, graph coloring, inclusion-exclusion, network algorithms, permutations, and trees. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3210

Mathematical Sciences.title: Abstract Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: Detailed study of abstract algebra: elementary number theory (congruences, quadratic residues, arithmetic functions), group theory (monoids, permutation groups, homomorphisms, quotients, Lagrange's theorem, finite abelian groups, Sylow's theorems), ring theory (domains, prime and maximal ideals, quotients, PID's), splitting fields, finite fields. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3310

Mathematical Sciences.title: Linear Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 208 A study of fundamental ideas in linear algebra and its applications. Includes review of basic operations, block computations; eigensystems of normal matrices; canonical forms and factorizations; singular value decompositions, pseudo inverses, least-square applications; matrix exponentials and linear systems of ODEs;quadratic forms, extremal properties, and bilinear forms. Pre-Requisite(s): (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330) and MA 3160

Mathematical Sciences.title: Complex Variables
Mathematical Sciences.description: A study of complex numbers, functions of a complex variable, analytic functions, elementary functions, integrals, Taylor and Laurent series, residues and poles, and conformal mapping. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3160

Mathematical Sciences.title: Real Analysis
Mathematical Sciences.description: Real analysis on Euclidean n-space. Topics include real and vector valued functions, metric and normed linear spaces; an introduction to Lebesgue measure and convergence theorems. Pre-Requisite(s): (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330) and MA 3160 and MA 3450

Mathematical Sciences.title: Introduction to Partial Differential Equations
Mathematical Sciences.description: An introduction to solution techniques for linear partial differential equations. Topics include: separation of variables, eigenvalue and boundary value problems, spectral methods, fourier series, and Green's functions. Studies applications in heat and mass transfer (diffusion eqn.), and mechanical vibrations (wave and beam eqns.). Pre-Requisite(s): (MA 3520 or MA 3521 or MA 3530 or MA 3560) and MA 3160

Mathematical Sciences.title: Applied Vector and Tensor Mathematics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to vector and tensor mathematics with applications. Topics include vectors; vector differential calculus, space curves; dyadic products and matrices; gradients, divergence, curl, Laplacians; Stokes' integral theorem, Gauss theorem, conservation laws; curvilinear coordinates; tensors, material derivatives; applications of potential theory in electricity and magnetism, heat transfer, solid and fluid mechanics. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3160 and (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Nonlinear Dynamics and Chaos
Mathematical Sciences.description: Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 209 Ordinary differential equations and dynamical systems via a modern geometric approach, including physical and engineering applications. May include chaotic phenomena and fractals. Pre-Requisite(s): (MA 3520 or MA 3521 or MA 3530 or MA 3560) and MA 3160

Mathematical Sciences.title: Numerical Linear Algebra
Mathematical Sciences.description: Design and analysis of algorithms for problems in linear algebra. Covers floating point arithmetic, condition numbers, error analysis; solution of linear systems (direct and iterative methods), eigenvalue problems, least squares, and singular value decomposition. Includes the use of appropriate software. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330

Mathematical Sciences.title: Numerical Methods for PDEs
Mathematical Sciences.description: Derivation, analysis, and implementation of numerical methods for partial differential equations; applications to fluid mechanics, elasticity, heat conduction, acoustics, or electromagnetism. Pre-Requisite(s): (MA 3520 or MA 3521 or MA 3530 or MA 3560) and MA 3160

Mathematical Sciences.title: Probability and Statistical Inference I
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduction to probabilistic methods. Topics include probability laws, counting rules, discrete and continuous random variables, moment generating functions, expectation, joint distributions, and the Central Unit Theorem. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3160 and (MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715)

tags.Restrictions: Permission of department required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Probability and Statistical Inference II
Mathematical Sciences.description: Topics include sampling distributions, theory of point and interval estimation, properties of estimators, and theory of hypothesis testing. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 4700

tags.Restrictions: Permission of department required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Regression Analysis
Mathematical Sciences.description: Covers simple, multiple, and polynomial regression; estimation, testing, and prediction; weighted least squares, matrix approach, dummy variables, multicollinearity, model diagnostics and variable selection. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 210 A statistical computing package is an integral part of the course. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715 or MA 5701

Mathematical Sciences.title: Design and Analysis of Experiments
Mathematical Sciences.description: Covers construction and analysis of completely randomized, randomized block, incomplete block, Latin squares, factorial, fractional factorial, nested and split-plot designs. Also examines fixed, random and mixed effects models and multiple comparisons and contrasts. The SAS statistical package is an integral part of the course. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715 or MA 5701

Mathematical Sciences.title: Nonparametric Statistics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Introduces nonparametric techniques that require less restrictive assumptions on the data. Topics include statistical inference concerning location and dispersion parameters as well as the general distributions. Goodness-of-fit tests for count and ordinal data are also discussed. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715

Mathematical Sciences.title: Mathematical Statistics I
Mathematical Sciences.description: Covers joint probability distributions, functions of random variables, sampling and limiting distributions, introduction to parameter estimation. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3720 or EE 3180

Mathematical Sciences.title: Mathematical Statistics II
Mathematical Sciences.description: Continuation of MA4760. Theory of point and interval estimation; properties of estimators, theory of hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, analysis of categorical data and other topics as time allows Pre-Requisite(s): MA 4760

Mathematical Sciences.title: Time Series Analysis and Forecasting
Mathematical Sciences.description: Statistical modeling and inference for analyzing experimental data that have been observed at different points in time. Topics include models for stationary and nonstationary time series, model specification, parametric estimation, and time regression models. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 211 Pre-Requisite(s): (MA 2710 or MA 2720 or MA 3710 or MA 3715) and (MA 3720 or EE 3180)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Predictive Modeling
Mathematical Sciences.description: Application, construction, and evaluation of statistical models used for prediction and classification. Topics include data visualization and exploratory methods, the normal theory regression model, logistic and Poisson regression, linear and quadratic discriminant analysis, and classification with logit models. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3740 or MA 4710 or MA 4720 or MA 4780

Mathematical Sciences.title: Financial Markets and Actuarial Math
Mathematical Sciences.description: Derivative Securities, hedging, arbitrage, binomial and Black-Scholes pricing models. Long-term insurance coverages, life insurance and annuities. May include other topics on professional SOA exams. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3720 and MA 3810

Mathematical Sciences.title: Loss Distributions and Actuarial Math
Mathematical Sciences.description: Loss distribution used for modeling insurance claims. Frequency, severity, coverage modifications, risk measures, models, credibility, short term insurance coverages. May include other topics on the C exam. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3720

Mathematical Sciences.title: Mathematical Sciences Project
Mathematical Sciences.description: Independent study in an area of mathematical sciences under the guidance of a faculty member.

tags.Credits: variable to 4.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6
tags.Restrictions: Permission of instructor required

Mathematical Sciences.title: Theory of Numbers with Technology
Mathematical Sciences.description: Mathematical induction, Euclid's algorithm, prime and composite integers, algebra of congruences, Chinese remainder theorem, quadratic reciprocity law, number theoretic functions, first degree Diophantine equations, Pythagorean triples, Fermat and Mersenne numbers, factoring algorithms, tests for primality and various applications. Projects use Mathematica and EXCEL software packages. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 3210 or MA 3310 or MA 3924

Mathematical Sciences.title: History of Mathematics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Survey of the development of mathematics from ancient times to today. How cultural, mathematical, and technological developments have influenced one another throughout history. Course provides all Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 212 necessary historical background. Pre-Requisite(s): UN 1015 and (UN 1025 or Modern Language - 3000 level or higher)

Mathematical Sciences.title: Topics in Mathematics
Mathematical Sciences.description: Students study in greater depth a particular area of mathematics not studied in existing courses. Mechanical Eng. - Engrg. Mech.

tags.Credits: variable to 4.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6
tags.Restrictions: Permission of instructor required

Unknown (MEEM).title: Statics
Unknown (MEEM).description: Force systems in two and three dimensions. Includes composition and resolution of forces and force systems, principles of equilibrium applied to various bodies, simple structures, friction, centroids, and moments of inertia. Vector algebra used where appropriate. Prerequisite of MA2160 with a grade of C or better is required. of Engineering Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of For Res & Env Sci, College

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanics of Materials
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introduction to mechanical behavior of materials, including stress/strain at a point, principle stresses and strains, stress-strain relationships, determination of stresses and deformations in situations involving axial loading, torsional loading of circular cross sections, and flexural loading of straight members. Also covers stresses due to combined loading and buckling of columns. of Engineering Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2110

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of For Res & Env Sci, College

Unknown (MEEM).title: Introductory Thermodynamics
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course introduces concepts of energy, energy conversion, mechanisms of heat and work transfer in processes and in cycles. It also covers the first and the second laws of thermodynamics. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 213 Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 and CH 1150 and CH 1151

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: Dynamics
Unknown (MEEM).description: First course in the principles of dynamics, covering the motion of a particle, the kinematics and kinetics of plane motion of rigid bodies, the principles of work and energy, impulse and momentum. Uses vector methods. Pre-Requisite(s): PH 2100 and (MEEM 2110 or ENG 2120)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanical Engineering Practice I
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students develop laboratory and computer skills, Topics include product dissection, data acquisition, materials testing, 2D finite element modeling, 1D modeling and simulation. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2110(C) and ENG 1102 and UN 1015

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanical Engineering Practice II
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students further develop testing and simulation skills as they validate dynamic mechanical and thermal/fluid systems. Course emphasizes application of energy conservation principles to physical engineering systems as well as analysis and communication of data. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2901 and MEEM 2201(C) and MEEM 2110

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: introductory Fluid Mechanics & Heat Transfer
Unknown (MEEM).description: Course emphasizes internal flow and modes of heat transfer: control volume analysis of mass, momentum and energy, pipe and duct flow, dimensional analysis, steady and unsteady heat conduction, internal convection and application of boundary conditions, and simple heat exchanger design. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2201 and MEEM 2911 and MA 3160

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanical System Design and Analysis
Unknown (MEEM).description: In this course, students learn mechanical synthesis and analysis methods. They use case studies to develop relationships between design and performance. They apply synthesis methods to the design of a new product. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 214 Engineering Pre-Requisite(s): (ENG 2120 or MEEM 2150) and MEEM 2700

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Robotics Engineering, Mechanical

Unknown (MEEM).title: Introduction to Manufacturing
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course introduces manufacturing processes, including deformation, subtractive, additive, and molding processes. Students learn how things are made in both low and high production environments. It includes design for manufacturing considerations. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2150 and MSE 2100

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: Dynamic Systems
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course deals with the modeling, analysis and control of mixed physics systems. It covers differential equation generation for mechanical, thermal, and electrical systems, their simulation, and methods for analyzing their performance operating in both open and closed loop. Engineering Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2700 and (MA 3520 or MA 3521 or MA 3530 or MA 3560)

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechatronics, Mechanical

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanical Engineering Practice III - Model Based Design
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students apply the engineering design process by combining engineering science with simulation tools to guide design decisions. They use energy-based models to determine design direction and design- based simulation to select and optimize components and subsystems to meet design requirements. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2911(C) and MEEM 2150 and MEEM 2700

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanical Engineering Practice IV
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students create simulations and validation procedures to verify that components and assembled system meet desired requirements. Experimental methods, simulation, data processing, comparing experimental and analytical results, and engineering communication methods are emphasized. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2911 and MEEM 3901(C) Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 215

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering

Unknown (MEEM).title: Special Topics in Mech Engg
Unknown (MEEM).description: Problems in mechanical engineering, engineering mechanics, manufacturing, or industrial engineering that are not covered in regular courses. Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore

tags.Credits: variable to 3.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanical Engineering Undergraduate Research Project
Unknown (MEEM).description: An undergraduate research experience during the junior year in mechanical engineering. Students work directly with faculty on active research projects/grants. A report will be submitted and graded. Major(s): Mechanical Eng-Eng Mechanics, Mechanical Engineering; May not be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore, Senior

tags.Credits: 3.0; Repeatable to a Max of 6

Unknown (MEEM).title: Intermediate Mechanics of Materials
Unknown (MEEM).description: Basic concepts of three-dimensional stress and strain. Inelastic behavior of axial members, circular shafts and symmetric beams. Deflections of indeterminate beams. Unsymmetrical bending, shear flow and shear center for open sections. Energy methods for structures made up of one-dimensional elements. Introduction to theories of failures. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2150

Unknown (MEEM).title: Failure of Materials in Mechanics
Unknown (MEEM).description: Identifies the modes of mechanical failure that are essential to prediction and prevention of mechanical failure. Discusses theories of failure in detail. Treats the topic of fatigue failure extensively and brittle fracture, impact and buckling failures at some length. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3400

Unknown (MEEM).title: Engineering Biomechanics
Unknown (MEEM).description: Engineering mechanics applied to the human body in health and disease or injury, which includes mechanics of human biological materials and engineering design in musculoskeletal system. Also studies on mechanics of posture (occupational biomechanics) and locomotion (sports biomechanics) using mathematical models of the human body. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2150 and MEEM 2700 Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 216

Unknown (MEEM).title: Principles of Energy Conversion
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introduces fundamentals of energy conversion and storage. Topics include fossil and nuclear fuels, thermodynamic power cycles, solar energy, photovoltaics, and energy storage. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201 or CM 3230 or ENG 3200 or CEE 3200 or MSE 3100

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Level(s): Graduate

Unknown (MEEM).title: Applied Thermodynamics
Unknown (MEEM).description: A study of the principles of thermodynamics, including fundamental concepts and introduction of the analytical treatments of the first and second laws. Topics include exergy, ideal and real gas mixtures, gas and vapor power cycles, psychrometry, combustion, and chemical equilibrium. Eng-Eng Mechanics, Engineering Mechanics Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201(C)

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical

Unknown (MEEM).title: Applied Fluid Mechanics & Heat Transfer
Unknown (MEEM).description: Intermediate fluid mechanics and heat transfer topics are covered. These include necessary considerations of: differential analysis of fluid flows based on Navier-Stokes equations, lift and drag, convective heat transfer in external flows, radiation, and simple considerations of condensation and boiling. Eng-Eng Mechanics, Engineering Mechanics Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical

Unknown (MEEM).title: Computational Fluids Engineering
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course introduces students to computational methods used to solve fluid mechanics and thermal transport problems. Computer-based tools are used to solve engineering problems involving fluid mechanics and thermal transport. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201(C)

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Level(s): Graduate

Unknown (MEEM).title: Internal Combustion Engines I
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course teaches the operational principles of spark-ignition and compression-ignition internal combustion engines through the application of thermodynamics, fluid dynamics, and heat transfer. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 217 Course studies engine performance, efficiency, and emissions using cycle-based analysis, combustion thermochemistry, and compressible fluid flow. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Level(s): Graduate

Unknown (MEEM).title: Compressible Flow/Gas Dynamics
Unknown (MEEM).description: Fundamentals of one-dimensional gas dynamics, including flow in nozzles and diffusers, normal shocks, frictional flows, and flows with heat transfer or energy release; introduction to oblique shocks. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201

Unknown (MEEM).title: Wind Energy
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course introduces students to the underlying principles of wind energy conversions, with an emphasis on engineering aspects of wind turbine design and construction, and the evaluation of wind resources. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201

Unknown (MEEM).title: Combustion & Air Pollution
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introduces sources of emissions from combustion, applies thermo-chemical principles to model the formation of pollutants, and identifies impacts of air pollutants on the environment and human health. Addresses pollution regulation and societal impacts including emissions, climate change, and air quality. enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore, Junior Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2201 or ENG 3200 or CEE 3200

Unknown (MEEM).title: Heating/Ventilation/Air Cond
Unknown (MEEM).description: Elements of heat transfer for buildings. Thermodynamic properties of moist air, human comfort and the environment, solar energy fundamentals and applications, water vapor transmission in building structures, heating and cooling load calculations. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201

Unknown (MEEM).title: Fuel Cell Technology
Unknown (MEEM).description: Fuel cell basics, operation principles and performance analysis. Emphasis on component materials and Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 218 transport phenomena on proton exchange membrane fuel cells along with other types of fuel cells. Hydrogen production, transportation, and storage. Balance of plant and systems analysis. enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Senior Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3201 or CM 3110

Unknown (MEEM).title: Introduction to Propulsion Systems for Hybrid Electric Vehicles
Unknown (MEEM).description: Hybrid electric vehicle analysis will be developed and applied to examine the operation, integration, and design of powertrain components. Model based simulation and design is applied to determine vehicle performance measures in comparison to vehicle technical specifications. Power flows, losses, energy usage, and drive quality are examined over drive-cycles via application of these tools. Computing; May not be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2700 or EE 2112

Unknown (MEEM).title: Experimental Studies in Hybrid Electric Vehicles
Unknown (MEEM).description: Hands-on course examines hybrid electric vehicles from an energy perspective. Topics include powertrain architecture, vehicle testing, fuel consumption, aerodynamics and rolling resistance, engines, batteries, electric machines and power electronics. Course culminates with study of system interactions with emphasis on idle reduction and regenerative braking. enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore, Junior

Unknown (MEEM).title: Mechanism Synthesis/Dynamic Modeling
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students apply kinematic synthesis techniques in design and analysis of mechanical systems. They develop synthesis software to link to dynamic analysis packages such as ADAMS, I-DEAS, Unigraphics, etc. They investigate influences of process variation on system output and learn methods to minimize the variation influences. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3400

Unknown (MEEM).title: Intro to the Finite Element Method
Unknown (MEEM).description: Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 219 Introduces the use of the finite element method in stress analysis and heat transfer. Emphasizes the modeling assumptions associated with different elements and uses the computer to solve many different types of stress analysis problems, including thermal stress analysis and introductory nonlinear analysis. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3400 and (MA 2320 or MA 2321 or MA 2330) and (MA 3520 or MA 3521 or MA 3530 or MA 3560)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Advanced Computer Aided Design and Manufacturing Methods
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students apply advanced solid modeling techniques to construct solid models of mechanical systems, document the design using GD&T conventions as per ASME standards, simulate the motion of the system, and learn the computer aided manufacturing and additive manufacturing techniques. Eng-Eng Mechanics, Engineering Mechanics; May not be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore, Junior Pre-Requisite(s): ENG 1102 and MEEM 3600

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical

Unknown (MEEM).title: Vehicle Dynamics
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course will develop the models and techniques needed to predict the performance of a road vehicle during drive off, braking, ride, and steering maneuvers. Topics to be covered include: acceleration and braking performance, power train architecture, vehicle handling, suspension modeling, tire models, and steering control. Matlab, Adams Car, and Amesim, will be used as computational tools. enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Vehicle Dynamics; Must be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Junior, Senior Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3400 or EE 3261

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering; Must be

Unknown (MEEM).title: Advanced Machining Processes
Unknown (MEEM).description: Covers mechanics of 2-D and 3-D cutting and their extension to commonly used conventional processes such as turning, boring, milling, and drilling. Topics include force modeling, surface generation, heat transfer, tool life and dynamics. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600

Unknown (MEEM).title: Metal Forming Processes
Unknown (MEEM).description: Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 220 Covers analytical and experimental study of metal forming processes, such as forging, extrusion, rolling, bending, stretch forming, and deep drawing as well as progressive die design for sheet metal stamping and design of dies for bulk forming. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600 and MEEM 2150

Unknown (MEEM).title: Precision Manuf and Metrology
Unknown (MEEM).description: Course presents theory and practice involved in manufacturing and measuring of precision components. Topics include precision machining processes, precision machine/mechanism design, and dimensional metrology. Also discusses current manufacturing challenges in the bearings, optics, and microelectronics industries. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600(C)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Human Factors
Unknown (MEEM).description: The usability of products and systems can be improved by considering human capabilities during their design. This course explores both the psychological and physical characteristics of human beings. It then presents how to apply human factors principles to the design process. enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore, Junior

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following College(s): College of Engineering; May not be

Unknown (MEEM).title: Design with Plastics
Unknown (MEEM).description: Covers various complexities in design of plastic parts and design of molds for manufacturing of plastic parts. Pre-Requisite(s): MSE 2100 and MEEM 2150 and (MEEM 3201(C) or CM 3110)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Micromanufacturing Processes
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introduces the processes and equipment for fabricating microsystems and the methods for measuring component size and system performance. Fabrication processes include microscale milling, drilling, diamond machining, and lithography. Measurement methods include interferometry and scanning electron microscopy. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3400(C) and MEEM 3600(C) Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 221

Unknown (MEEM).title: Quality Engineering
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introduction to the concepts and methods of quality and productivity improvement. Topics include principles of Shewhart, Deming, Taguchi; meaning of quality; control charts for variables, individuals, and attributes; process capability analysis. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600(C) and (MA 3710 or MA 3720 or MA 2710 or MA 2720)

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Junior, Senior

Unknown (MEEM).title: Production Planning
Unknown (MEEM).description: Covers fundamental production planning topics as capacity management, facility layout, process design and analysis, forecasting, inventory management, MRP, scheduling, and theory of constraints. Introduces basic lean concepts, lean production, and value stream mapping. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600(C)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Introduction to Lean Manufacturing
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introduces lean manufacturing tools, techniques, and practices. Topics include Muda, 5S, visual factory, VSM, theory of constraints, standardized work, pull system, SMED, TPM and lean assessment. Business; Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600

Unknown (MEEM).description: Material handling deals with the handling operations and stock of material inside a warehouse. Emphasis is given to design, static and dynamic analysis and component sizing of lifts, cranes, continuous handling equipment (conveyors) and forklifts. Business; May not be enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Freshman, Sophomore, Junior Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2150

Unknown (MEEM).title: Env Resp Design & Manuf
Unknown (MEEM).description: Examines the impact of engineering and design/manufacturing, decisions on the environment. Topics include sustainability; energy and material flows; risk assessment; life cycles, manufacturing process waste streams, and product design issues, including disassembly and post-use product handling and techniques for pollution prevention. Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 222

Unknown (MEEM).description: Background, principles, process chain, software aspects, post-processing, open-source tools, applications, and future directions of AM technologies are discussed. enrolled in one of the following Class(es): Senior Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3600(C)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Analytical and Experimental Modal Analysis
Unknown (MEEM).description: Combined experimental and analytical approach to mechanical vibration issues; characterization of the dynamic behavior of a structure in terms of its modal parameters; digital data acquisition and signal processing; experimental modal analysis procedures; parameter estimation for obtaining modal parameters; model validation and correlation with analytical models; structural dynamics modification. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3750

Unknown (MEEM).title: Shock and Vibration
Unknown (MEEM).description: Theory and experimental techniques in vibration control, Shock, structural health monitoring, condition based maintenance, dynamic measurements, test methods, and planning. Eng-Eng Mechanics, Engineering Mechanics Pre-Requisite(s): (MEEM 3911 and MEEM 3750) or MEEM 4775

tags.Restrictions: Must be enrolled in one of the following Major(s): Mechanical Engineering, Mechanical

Unknown (MEEM).title: Acoustics and Noise Control
Unknown (MEEM).description: Analysis and solution of practical environmental noise problems. Fundamental concepts of sound generation and propagation, the unwanted effects of noise, assessment of sound quality, and source- path-receiver concepts in noise control. Lecture, measurement laboratory, and team project directed at solving a real noise problem under a client's sponsorship. Pre-Requisite(s): MA 2160 Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 223

Unknown (MEEM).title: Robotics and Mechatronics
Unknown (MEEM).description: Cross-discipline system integration of sensors, actuators, and microprocessors to achieve high-level design requirements, including robotic systems. A variety of sensor and actuation types are introduced, from both a practical and a mathematical perspective. Embedded microprocessor applications are developed using the C programming language. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3750 or EE 3160

Unknown (MEEM).title: Autonomous Systems
Unknown (MEEM).description: The main concepts of autonomous systems will be introduced including motion control, navigation, and intelligent path planning and perception. This is a hands-on project based course. Students will have the opportunity to work with mobile robotics platforms. Robotics Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Mechanical Engineering Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3750 or MEEM 4775(C) or EE 3160

Unknown (MEEM).title: Space Mechanics
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course presents the vector-based solution of the two-body problem and the solution for Kepler's equations. The course will also cover basic orbit determination techniques, impulsive orbit transfer maneuvers, interplanetary trajectories, ground tracks, and rendezvous problems. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 2700

tags.Restrictions: May not be enrolled in one of the following Level(s): Graduate

Unknown (MEEM).title: Dynamic System Simulation
Unknown (MEEM).description: Methods for simulating dynamic systems described by ordinary differential equations using numerical integration are developed. Quantifying simulation errors for both batch and real-time, control system applications is covered along with numerical optimization strategies for model validation. MATLAB and Simulink are used to illustrate key concepts. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3750

Unknown (MEEM).title: Analysis & Design of Feedback Control Systems
Unknown (MEEM).description: This course covers topics of control systems design. Course includes a review for modeling of dynamical systems, stability, and root locus design. Also covers control systems design in the frequency domain, fundamentals of digital control and nonlinear systems. Unknown (MEEM).title: Introduction to Aerospace Engineering
Unknown (MEEM).description: Introductory course on topics relevant to aerospace engineering and science. Topics include history, properties of the atmosphere, the solar system, atmospheric and space vehicles, mission design, and vehicle design and performance. Pre-Requisite(s): (MEEM 2150 or ENG 2120) and (MEEM 3201 or ENG 3200 or CEE 3200)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Introduction to Aerospace Propulsion
Unknown (MEEM).description: Principles of jet propulsion, cycle analysis and component analysis (non-rotating components, compressors, turbines). Principles of rocket propulsion, chemical rockets, propellants, turbomachinery, electrical propulsion. Review of thermodynamics for fluid flow, one-dimensional gas dynamics, and boundary layer theory included. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 4230(C)

Unknown (MEEM).title: Naval Systems and Platforms
Unknown (MEEM).description: Concepts of semi- and fully-autonomous naval and marine sensors and sensing platforms demonstrated through classroom learning and hands-on experiences. Unknown (MEEM).title: Senior Capstone Design I
Unknown (MEEM).description: Students work in teams on "open-ended" engineering capstone design projects - most with industrial sponsors - developing original and creative solutions to real engineering problems. Pre-Requisite(s): MEEM 3400 and EE 3010(C) and MEEM 3600(C) and MEEM 3901 and MEEM 3201 and MEEM 3750 and MEEM 3911 and MA 3710(C)

Unknown (MEEM).description: Undergraduate Course Descriptions Effective Fall 2023, Page 225 Design projects started in MEEM4901 are completed and evaluated using computer-aided engineering methods, physical models, and/or prototypes as appropriate. Pre-Requisite(s): EE 3010 and MEEM 3201 and MEEM 3600 and MEEM 3750 and MEEM 4901
